Home (The Gathering album)

Home

Released 15 April 2006 (except North America)
18 April 2006 (North America)
Recorded 2005-2006, at La Divina Commedia Church in Maurik, The Netherlands

Length 60:25
Label Noise/Sanctuary (N04182) (except North America)
The End Records (TE065) (North America)

The Gathering chronology
Sleepy Buildings
(2004)		 Home

Professional ratings
Review scores
Source Rating
Allmusic [1]

Home is the eighth album by Dutch band The Gathering. The album was released on 15 April 2006 by Sanctuary Records through its heavy metal label Noise. The album had a separate release in North America which took place on 18 April 2006 by Brooklyn-based label The End Records. It was the last album to feature lead singer and lyricist Anneke van Giersbergen.

In an interview for the San Diego-based magazine Modern Fix, drummer Hans Rutten described Home as being "more stripped-down...Souvenirs was quite structured and was quite heavy to make. This one is more simple, I think, but still there, still in a Gathering kind of way. But rhythmically speaking, it's more stripped-down, it’s more primitive, I think. I think 'primitive' is a good word...it’s more instinctive (and) more primitive. It’s not as layered as Souvenirs, and maybe it’s less 'trippish.' Maybe it’s more...yeah, primitive trip-rock, something like that."[2]

Personnel[edit]

  • Anneke van Giersbergen - lead singer/guitars
  • René Rutten - guitars/flute
  • Marjolein Kooijman - bass
  • Hans Rutten - drums
  • Frank Boeijen - keyboards
